abstract: Apple may have taken another step in the age of citizen journalism, with the addition of a new video recording function that will turn millions of the company’s phones into video cameras.
snippet: Apple may have taken another step in the age of citizen journalism, with the addition of a new video recording function that will turn millions of the company’s phones into video cameras.
lead_paragraph: From Our Colleague, Brian Stelter, at Media Decoder:

headline.main: The New iPhone Breaks Ground — and News

abstract: Apple also showed off a new operating system and cheaper laptops during its Worldwide Developers Conference.
snippet: Apple also showed off a new operating system and cheaper laptops during its Worldwide Developers Conference.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Apple offered its devoted fans their periodic supply of catnip on Monday with a new version of the iPhone, called the iPhone 3G S.

headline.main: iPhone Stars in Apple Show, Supported by Software
headline.print_headline: IPhone Stars in Apple Show, Supported by Software

byline.original: By Brad Stone and Jenna Wortham

abstract: Asustek, which pioneered the netbook, is dreaming big, hoping to offer everything from smartphones to game consoles.
snippet: Asustek, which pioneered the netbook, is dreaming big, hoping to offer everything from smartphones to game consoles.
lead_paragraph: Update | 12:44 p.m.  Clarifying to reflect that Asustek now says that the company has no plans for a game console and that Jonathan Tsang was only describing the features of a game controller that would be used with a PC. Also clarifying language about Asus’s brand recognition in the United States.
